TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed MediaState extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the states that can be applied to a for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.LoadedBehavior%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.UnloadedBehavior%2A> properties.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.MediaState Close = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The state used to close the media. All media resources are released (including video memory).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.MediaState Manual = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The state used to control a manually. Interactive methods like <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Play%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.Pause%2A> can be used. Media will preroll but not play when the is assigned valid media source.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.MediaState Pause = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The state used to pause the media. Media will preroll but remains paused when the is assigned valid media source.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.MediaState Play = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The state used to play the media. . Media will preroll automatically being playback when the is assigned valid media source.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.MediaState Stop = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The state used to stop the media. Media will preroll but not play when the is assigned valid media source. Media resources are not released.
